Detailed Description

There is only one unique key to distinguish Bluetooth Devices. This key is a 48 bit value and is called a device address. BtDeviceAddress is an object orientated representation of such a 48 bit device address.

Member Function Documentation

WString & BtDeviceAddress::AsString (  WString &  string  )  const
 

Convert to a string.

AsString converts the binary representation of this address to a human readable form that looks like: "XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX" where the "XX"s are a hexadecimal number in the range of 0x00..0xFF.

Parameters:
string A reference to a WString where to store the converted device address.
Returns:
The reference to a WString that was passed in, to enable the usage of AsString in a string concatenation sequence.

const btapi_bdaddr_t & BtDeviceAddress::GetApiDeviceAddress (   )  const
 

Get address as Bluetooth C-API address.

GetApiDeviceAddress returns this device address as a btapi_bdaddr_t needed by the Bluetooth stack.

Returns:
A reference to a btapi_bdaddr_t containtng this address as needed by the Bluetooth stack.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceAddress::operator!= (  const BtDeviceAddress &  device_address  )  const
 

inequality compare operator

operator!= is the comparison operator that checks inequality of two BtDeviceAddresses.

Parameters:
device_address A reference to a BtDeviceAddress that should be compared to this.
Returns:
TRUE: The passed in device address is not equal to this device address.
FASLE: The passed in device address is equal to this device address.

BtDeviceAddress & BtDeviceAddress::operator= (  const BtDeviceAddress &  device_address  ) 
 

assignment operator

operator= assigns the passed in BtDeviceAddress to this device address.

Parameters:
device_address A reference to a BtDeviceAddress that should assigned to this.
Returns:
A reference to a BtDeviceAddress containing this new assigned address.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceAddress::operator== (  const BtDeviceAddress &  device_address  )  const
 

equality compare operator

operator== is the comparison operator that checks equality of two BtDeviceAddresses.

Parameters:
device_address A reference to a BtDeviceAddress that should be compared to this.
Returns:
TRUE: The passed in device address is equal to this device address.
FASLE: The passed in device address is not equal to this device address.

void BtDeviceAddress::SetApiDeviceAddress (  const btapi_bdaddr_t &  api_devcie_address  ) 
 

Set the address to the Bluetooth C-API address.

SetApiDeviceAddress assigns the passed in device address that is in the format that the Bluetooth stack returns to this address.

Parameters:
api_devcie_address A reference to a btapi_bdaddr_t containing the device address, which this address should be assigned to.
